jirleech writes:
> The question I have is without completely analyzing all the java src
> code,  where would the best place be to add the functionality to
> actually download or mirror a site instead of archiving it?  I need
> this functionality to save copies of sites for evidential purposes.

Kristinn's answer covers the Heritrix view, but I wonder if Heritrix
is overkill for that: wget can mirror a site, rewriting most URLs,
quite effectively. It's also very fast.

If you wanted to use Heritrix you could also extract the sites from
the ARC files for browsing: presumably the Wayback machine is doing
this in some way.
